thread.title: Motorola Moto X Force: 5.4-inch quad hd with octa-core, 3Gb ram, 21mp camera and is as strong as it gets
thread.title_full: Motorola Moto X Force: 5.4-inch quad hd with octa-core, 3Gb ram, 21mp camera and is as strong as it gets

author: webmaster@whatech.com.au (Eza Ezamie)
title: Motorola Moto X Force: 5.4-inch quad hd with octa-core, 3Gb ram, 21mp camera and is as strong as it gets
text:
News from: Eza Ezamie Page views: 802 times We have heard of numerous stories where people spent a fortune to get themselves a flagship device, but in an instant it could have been dropped and suffered irreversible damage. That is all set to change with the introduction of Motorola Moto X Force which is a flagship that can withstand almost everything that you literally throw at it. - Advertisement - 
Expected to be released sometime in December (just in time for the year-end holidays), there’s no denying that the Moto X-Force will be a force that you would reckon with. If you have the dough to spend, that is. 
Well let’s get down and dirty shall we? 
A smartphone that is tough with flagship specs are almost always never mentioned in the same sentence. It is still preliminary at this moment that we haven’t got any clue on its dimension and weight. 
But what we do know for certain is that the Moto X-Force will be IP68 certified – which means that it is dust and water resistant up to 1.5 meters and for a duration of 30 minutes. Next is that it will be able to withstand almost anything with its MIL-STD-810G certification. 
This means that it is salt, dust, humidity, rain, vibration, solar radiation, transport and thermal shock resistant. It can pretty much withstand everything, and that means you can take it everywhere with you. - Advertisement - 
Screen-wise, the Moto X Force will be sporting a 5.43-inch Quad HD screen that displays 1440 x 2560 pixels or ~541 ppi pixel density that should make for some awesome images being displayed on the screen. As if the protection is not sufficient, the screen will also be equipped with Corning Gorilla Glass 4 as an added measure. 
Once you check out what’s under the hood of the Moto X-Force, then you would know how good it will be. It is expected to have the Qualcomm MSM8994 Snapdragon 810 chipset, a blazingly fast Octa-core processor comprising a Quad-core 1.5 GHz Cortex-A53 & Quad-core 2 GHz Cortex-A57, Adreno 430 graphics and 3GB RAM. 
That’s some serious firepower, and it will surely eat up anything that comes in its way for sure. - Advertisement - 
Now that you know how powerful the hardware is, you will also be amazed at its camera department as well. There will be a 21 Megapixel primary camera with 5248 x 3936, phase detection autofocus, dual-LED (dual tone) flash, geo-tagging, touch focus, face detection, panorama, and auto-HDR. 
This will let you take all those high-res photos that you never thought possible. Then there’s the 5 Megapixel secondary camera that will have an LED flash for all your selfies and video calls. 
As far as storage is concerned, the Moto X-Force will have two available variants. You have an option of going for either 32GB or 64GB. 
Plus, there will also be a microSD slot that will support future expansion up to a cool 128GB of space. 
In terms of software, you should not worry as it will surely be shipping with the latest Android Lollipop release. 
Finally, there’s the battery part, and the Moto X-Force surely excels with its non-removable 3760 mAh battery. Technically it should be able to power up the device for at least a day or two in between charging. - Advertisement - 
The Motorola Moto X-Force is first and foremost a virtually indestructible smartphone. Not only that, it has some serious specs and hardware that makes for a flagship-grade. 
These two potent combinations would then make for an awesome device and just in time for you to be shopping for gadgets come this year-end. It will then boils down to whether or not you will be able to afford it. 
The Motorola Moto X-Force is expected to be released in December 2015 although there’s no indication of the pricing just yet. But there have been rumors that it will be more than $600, perhaps closer to the $700 price tag. 
It will only be available in black, though. News From
